page.title: 12SKELMERSDALE - TRANSPORT
page.content: Skelmersdale New Town was built to separate{motorists}from{pedestrians and the walk-ways of the town make great use of underpasses and bridges and there are large areas in all the housing areas which are free of {motorised transport.}This means in practice that there are no pavements beside the roads but as these are often the quickest routes between different places many people actually walk on the roads. The town was built for a 'motorised' population but partly as a result of high unemployment this aim has not been achieved and there are signs of planned roads which have never been built. The design of the town promotes the heavy use of Taxis refered to on a previous page.
